intro: Centaurium curvistamineum, commonly known as the bent-stem centaury, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its slender, often curved stems and small, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Centaurium curvistamineum is known for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
